Mass Transfer Processes.name: Molar Flux of Species

variables.N_{i}: Molar flux of species(moles of species per unit area per unit time)
variables.c_{i}: Molar concentration of species(moles of species per unit volume
variables.v_{i}: Velocity of species relative to a fixed reference frame(length per unit time

Mass Transfer Processes.description: Used to quantify the rate at which moles pf a species flow through a surface,essential for describing transport in multicomponent systems.

Mass Transfer Processes.name: Mass flux of species

variables.n_{i}: Mass flux of species(mass of species per unit area per unit time
variables.\\rho_i: Mass concentration(density) of species(mass of species per unit volume)
variables.v_{i}: Velocity of species(length per unit time)

Mass Transfer Processes.description: Calculates the mass transport rate of a species across a surface,parallel to molar flux but in mass terms,usefull in systems where density variations matter.

Mass Transfer Processes.name: Molar concentration relation

variables.c_{i}: Molar concentration of species(moles per unit volume)
variables.c: Total molar concentration of the mixture

Mass Transfer Processes.description: Relates a species' concentration to it mole fraction in a mixture,foundational for multicomponent analysis in gases or solutions.

Mass Transfer Processes.name: Mass concentration relation
Mass Transfer Processes.description: Connects a species' mass density to its mass fraction used in mass-based calculations for mixtures.

Mass Transfer Processes.name: Fick's first law of diffusion (Diffusive Molar Flux)

variables.J_{Az}: Diffusive molar flux of species in the z direction
variables.D_{AB}: Diffusion coefficient of A in B
variables.\\frac{dc_A}{dz}: Concentration gradient of species in the z direction

Mass Transfer Processes.description: Describes the diffusive transport of a species due to a concentration gradient,fundamental for a molecular diffusion in binary systems.

Mass Transfer Processes.name: Total molar flux of species

variables.N_{A}: Total molar flux of species A
variables.N: Total molar flux of the mixture
variables.\\frac{dx_A}{dz}: Mole fraction gradient in the z direction

Mass Transfer Processes.description: Combines convective and diffusive contriubtions to the total flux used in systems with bulk flow and diffusion.

Mass Transfer Processes.name: Reynold's number for falling liquid film

variables.\\Gamma: Mass flow rate per unit width

Mass Transfer Processes.description: Characterizes flow regimes(eg.la,imar or turbulent) in thin liquid films,important for mass transfer in absorption or evaporation processes.

Mass Transfer Processes.name: Molar flow rate in falling film (Concentration Difference)

variables.n_{A}: Molar flow rate of species A

Mass Transfer Processes.description: Calculates the rate of species transfer in a falling film based on concentration changes,applied in gas-liquid contactors.

Mass Transfer Processes.name: Mass transfer rate using coefficient

variables.n_{A}: Molar flow rate of species A

Mass Transfer Processes.description: Quantifies the overall rate of mass transfer across an i terface using an empirircal coefficient,widely used in deign of separation equipment like absorbers and distillers.

Mass Transfer Processes.name: Fick's second Law of Diffusion

variables.D_{AB}: Diffusion coefficient of species A in B

Mass Transfer Processes.description: Describes the time-dependent diffusuion of species in a medium,used to model unsteady-state diffusion processes,such as gas diffusion into a liquid or transient concentration profiles.

Mass Transfer Processes.name: Sherwood number
Mass Transfer Processes.description: A dimensionless number representing the ratio of convective to diffusive mass transfer,used to correlate mass transfer coefficints in systems like packed beds or boundary layers.

Mass Transfer Processes.name: Schmidt number
Mass Transfer Processes.description: Represents the ratio of momentum diffusivity to mass diffusivity used in analyzing the relative thickness of momentum and concentration boundary layers in convective mass transfer.

Mass Transfer Processes.name: Mass transfer coefficients for Gas Phase (Two Film Theory)

variables.P_{Ag}: Partial pressure of A in the bulk gas phase
variables.P_{Ai}: Partial pressure at the gas-liquid interphase

Mass Transfer Processes.description: used in gas-liquid mass transfer(eg.absorption) to describe the rate of transfer across the gas film based on the partial pressure driving force.

Mass Transfer Processes.name: Mass transfer coefficient for liquid phase (Two Film Theory)

variables.c_{A}: Equilibrium concentration of A corresponding to the bulk gas partial pressure
variables.c_{A0}: Concentration of A in the bulk liquid

Mass Transfer Processes.description: Used in liquid-phase controlled systems to calculate the overall mass transfer rate,incorporating both phase resistances.

Mass Transfer Processes.name: Height of a transfer unit (HTU)

variables.HTU_{G}: Height of a transfer unit for the gas phase
variables.G: Molar flow rate of gas per unit cross-sectional area

Mass Transfer Processes.description: Used in packed column design(eg.absorption towers) to estimate the height required for a unit of mass transfer.

Mass Transfer Processes.name: Overall Mass Transfer Coefficient

variables.k_A: Mass transfer coefficient in phase A
variables.k_B: Mass transfer coefficient in phase B

Mass Transfer Processes.description: Relates individual phase mass transfer resistances to the overall resistance in a two-phase system.

Mass Transfer Processes.name: Mass Transfer in Packed Column (Kremser Equation)

variables.y: Concentration of solute in the outlet

Mass Transfer Processes.description: Used to calculate the solute concentration profile along a packed column under steady flow.

Mass Transfer Processes.name: Interfacial Area in Packed Column
Mass Transfer Processes.description: Estimates the gas-liquid contact area in packed beds.

Mass Transfer Processes.name: Two-film Theory Mass Transfer Flux

variables.P_A^*: Gas equilibrium partial pressure at interface
variables.C_A^*: Concentration of A in liquid at interface

Mass Transfer Processes.description: Relates flux to concentration difference across the interface for gas-liquid systems.

Mass Transfer Processes.name: Mass Transfer Coefficient from Sherwood Number
Mass Transfer Processes.description: Converts dimensionless Sherwood number to mass transfer coefficient.

Mass Transfer Processes.name: Diffusion Coefficient from Chapman-Enskog Equation

variables.D_{AB}: Diffusion coefficient of A in B

Mass Transfer Processes.description: Predicts binary gas diffusion coefficients using molecular properties and temperature.

Mass Transfer Processes.name: Mass Transfer in Laminar Flow
Mass Transfer Processes.description: Correlation for mass transfer in laminar flow inside tubes.

Mass Transfer Processes.name: Mass Transfer in Turbulent Flow
Mass Transfer Processes.description: Correlation for mass transfer in turbulent flow inside pipes and ducts.

Mass Transfer Processes.name: Plate Height in Packed Column (HTU)
Mass Transfer Processes.description: Relates packed bed height to transfer units for design purposes.

Mass Transfer Processes.name: Number of Transfer Units (NTU)

variables.Y: Mole fraction or concentration at any point

Mass Transfer Processes.description: Used to quantify the difficulty of achieving desired separation in absorption or stripping.

Mass Transfer Processes.name: Colburn Analogy for Mass Transfer
Mass Transfer Processes.description: Relates convective mass transfer to heat transfer analogies in turbulent flow.
